阿拉伯联合酋长国迪拜 - 美国官员缉获了一系列伊朗的伊朗国家联系新闻网站，美国官员表示，这一举动似乎是对伊朗媒体的深远镇压加剧了两国之间的紧张局势。
  官方谈到了匿名的条件，因为美国政府尚未正式宣布，美国有效地缩小了大约三十三个网站，大多数都与伊朗的诽谤努力相关。
 由于世界权力争夺来争夺德黑兰的核交易，伊朗坚硬的司法队埃布拉姆·罗萨的选举胜利，武出争夺德黑兰的核交易。周一，Raisi，以他对西方的敌意而闻名，在他的第一个新闻发布会中击败了一个坚硬的位置。他排除了与乔·赫努总统（Joe Biden）会面或谈判德黑兰的弹道导弹方案，并对区域民兵的支持 - 担心拜登政府希望在未来的会谈中解决。
  伊朗与美国之间的关系多年来一直恶化了唐纳德特朗普从德黑兰核交易的撤回和毁灭该国的毁灭性制裁。随着时间的推移，这一决定已经看到了伊朗，逐渐放弃了对铀浓缩的每一个限制。该国现在正在富集铀达60％，其最高级别，但仍然缺乏武器级别。
 伊朗为该地区的激进群体提供支持，例如黎巴嫩的武装人士真主党和也门的Houthi叛乱分子，因为它寻求挥动其影响力远远偏见并抵制其敌人。
  周二，访问少数场地的地址，包括伊朗国家电视的英语武器新闻电视，伊明·哈福·普拉马拉卫星新闻频道和伊朗州电视的阿拉伯语频道，Al-Alam，制作了联邦抛售注意。它表示，该网站被美国工业和安全部门和安全局和联邦调查局委任“作为执法行动的一部分”被扣押。
  美国政府也接管了今天新闻网站巴勒斯坦的域名，这反映了加沙为基础的伊斯兰武装群体哈马斯和伊斯兰圣战的观点，将网站重定向到同样的挖掘通知。 
新闻电视于2007年6月推出，是国立伊朗广播的英语服务的国务伊斯兰共和国。其基于伊朗的网站，presstv.ir，不受影响。
  缉获的大多数域似乎是“.NET”，“.com”和“.tv”域。前两个是通用的顶级域，而不是特定国家的域名，而“.tv”由图瓦卢太平洋岛国家所有，但由美国公司浏览管理。在伊朗“.IR”等主要国家特定的顶级领域上夺取域名将是普遍存在违反主权的广泛国际谴责。
  这不是美国第一次抓住它指责传播消号的网站的域名。
 去年10月，司法部宣布推出近百个网站与伊朗强大的革命卫队相关联。美国说，在真正的新闻网点的幌子下运作的网站正在发动一项“全球消毒竞选活动”，以影响美国政策，推动世界各地的伊朗宣传。
  也门的Houthi Rebel Group宣布其Al-Masirah卫星新闻频道周二脱阵，恕不另行通知。它表示，该频道将继续在其“面对美国和以色列对我们国家的盗版行为”的使命中的使命。
 互联网基础设施专家Ron Guilmette表示，为域名提供名称服务的名称服务的责任在周二上午日期举行的欧洲时间中午。 RiskiQ的网络安全研究人员发现共共享相同的Amazon名称服务器的24站。
  伊朗没有私人电视或广播电台。卫星菜肴，虽然普遍存在，也是非法的。将Irib融入国内风波。 
Marzieh Hashemi是一位突出的新闻电视锚架，在2019年，在2019年被逮捕为在未指明的刑事案件中作为物质证人被捕，并且在华盛顿盛大陪审团之前出现，告诉美联社，该渠道正在努力“弄清楚原因”癫痫发作。
 虽然在伊朗播出，通过伊斯兰共和国的领导者看世界的镜头，在伊朗播出电视专注于国际事务。对英国和美国外交政策的激烈批评很常见。自1979年伊斯兰革命以来，IRIB一直掌握在劳动的落地手中，返回伊朗政府。
 在其报告中，新闻电视以前遇到了西方当局的麻烦。反诽谤联盟批评了该渠道，作为“世界领先的党派反犹太主义的一个英语派遣国之一”。
  在波士顿的华盛顿和Frank Bajak的相关新闻界作家埃里克·塔克有助于这份报告。
     当天最重要的新闻故事，由邮政编辑策划并每天早上交付。

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — American authorities seized a range of Iran’s state-linked news website domains they accused of spreading “disinformation” on Tuesday, a U.S. official said, a move that appeared to be a far-reaching crackdown on Iranian media amid heightened tensions between the two countries.
  The official, who spoke on condition of anonymity because the case had not yet been officially announced by the American government, said the U.S. had effectively taken down roughly three dozen websites, the majority linked to Iranian disinformation efforts.
 The takedowns come as world powers scramble to resurrect Tehran’s tattered 2015 nuclear deal and just days after the election victory of Iran’s hard-line judiciary chief, Ebrahim Raisi. On Monday, Raisi, known for his hostility to the West,  staked out a hard-line position in his first news conference. He ruled out the possibilities of meeting with President Joe Biden or negotiating over Tehran’s ballistic missile program and support for regional militias — concerns the Biden administration wants addressed in future talks.
  Relations between Iran and the U.S. have deteriorated for years following then-President Donald Trump’s withdrawal from Tehran’s nuclear deal and return of devastating sanctions on the country. That decision has seen Iran, over time, gradually abandon every limit on uranium enrichment. The country is now enriching uranium to 60%, its highest level ever, though still short of weapons-grade levels.
 Iran provides support to militant groups in the region, such as Lebanon’s militant Hezbollah and Yemen’s Houthi rebels, as it seeks to wield its influence far afield and counter its foes.
  On Tuesday, visiting the addresses of a handful of sites, including Iran state television’s English-language arm Press TV, Yemeni Houthi-run Al-Masirah satellite news channel and Iranian state TV’s Arabic-language channel, Al-Alam, produced a federal takedown notice. It said the websites were seized “as part of law enforcement action” by the U.S. Bureau of Industry and Security, Office of Export Enforcement and the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
  The U.S. government also took over the domain name of the news website Palestine Today, which reflects the view points of Gaza-based Islamic militant groups Hamas and Islamic Jihad, redirecting the site to the same takedown notice.
 Press TV, launched in June 2007, is the state-run Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting’s English-language service. Its Iran-based website, PressTV.ir, was not affected.
  Most of the domains seized appeared to be “.net,” “.com” and “.tv” domains. The first two are generic top-level domains as opposed to country-specific domains, while “.tv” is owned by the Pacific island nation of Tuvalu but administered by the U.S. company Verisign. Seizing a domain on a major country-specific top-level domain such as Iran’s “.ir” would be apt to produce widespread international condemnation as a violation of sovereignty.
  It’s not the first time that the U.S. has seized domain names of sites it accuses of spreading disinformation.
 Last October, the Department of Justice announced the takedown of nearly a hundred websites linked to Iran’s powerful Revolutionary Guard. The U.S. said the sites, operating under the guise of genuine news outlets, were waging a “global disinformation campaign” to influence U.S. policy and push Iranian propaganda around the world.
  Yemen’s Houthi rebel group announced that its Al-Masirah satellite news channel went offline Tuesday without prior notice. It said the channel would continue in its mission of “confronting the American and Israeli acts of piracy against our nation, by any means.”
 Responsibility for providing name service for the domain name presstv.com was apparently switched to an Amazon name server on Tuesday at mid-afternoon European time, said internet infrastructure expert Ron Guilmette. Cybersecurity researchers at RiskIQ found a total of 24 seized sites sharing the same Amazon name server.
  There are no private television or radio stations in Iran. Satellite dishes, while widespread, also are illegal. That leaves IRIB with a monopoly on domestic airwaves.
  Marzieh Hashemi, a prominent Press TV anchorwoman who, in 2019, was arrested as material witness in an unspecified criminal case and has appeared before a grand jury in Washington, told The Associated Press that the channel was struggling to “figure out the reasons” for the seizure.
 While airing in Iran, Press TV focuses predominantly on international affairs through the lens of how leaders in the Islamic Republic see the world. Fierce criticism of British and American foreign policy is common. Since the 1979 Islamic Revolution, IRIB has been in the hands of hard-liners who back Iran’s government.
 Press TV has previously run into trouble with Western authorities over its reporting. The Anti-Defamation League has criticized the channel as “one of the world’s leading dispensers of conspiratorial anti-Semitism in English.”
  Associated Press writers Eric Tucker in Washington and Frank Bajak in Boston contributed to this report.
     The most important news stories of the day, curated by Post editors and delivered every morning.
title: 美国取消了伊朗联系的新闻网站，声称不诚实
title_en: US takes down Iran-linked news sites, alleges disinformation

我们所有人都被认为努力平等成功的信念。在学校，我们教导了，如果我们努力学习，我们会得到更好的成绩。在体育中，如果我们练习更多，如果我们更加努力，我们将在工作中表现更好，在工作中，我们将更成功。我也很长大了，但我已经开始改变了我的思想。
 人才，努力和坚持不懈都是必要的，但没有足够的条件在生活中取得成功。
 1）比尔盖茨幸运地诞生于一个富裕的家庭。他与IBM的主席的母亲的社交联系使他能够从那时领先的PC公司获得合同，这对于建立他的软件帝国至关重要。 2）谷歌创始人，Sergey Brin和Larry页面试图在90年代销售100万美元到Excite.com。幸运的是，这笔交易没有发生。 3）一位年轻的Sachin Tendulkar想成为一个快速的球员。但是，当他访问钦奈的MRF PACE基金会时，澳大利亚传奇Dennis Lillee建议Sachin专注于他的击球。如果与利勒尔的会面没有发生怎么办？或Sachin选择无论如何都忽略了建议吗？ 4）Amitabh Bachchan希望成为一个无线电演示者，但被印度所有无线电（空中）反复拒绝。如果Bachchan先生通过了空中测试并在收音机而不是电影中取得了职业生涯的情况怎么办？
 没有人能否认所有上述人员都在努力实现各自的职业生涯中的专业成功。但正如我们所看到的，运气太扮演了一个关键部分。
  近年来，许多研究表明运气和机会比我们实现的更大的角色。
 Gregory Clark，一位经济学教授使用罕见的姓氏，以使父母的财富与800多个国家的几个国家相匹配，以及他们在全球的几个国家的后代。他发现“富人的富人，穷人穷人。”这不仅仅是关于财富的转移。它与健康基因，信心，教育和联系的礼物有关，这是幸运的幸运能够出生于一个良好的家庭。
 克拉克证实你开始的地方与你最终的地方有很大关系。 
运气在职业生涯中扮演的角色怎么样？三位意大利教授创造了一个模型，以跟踪一系列幸运和不幸的活动的1,000人的成功，遍布了40年的职业生涯。结果？
 他们发现几乎从未做过最有才华的人达到最高的成功峰。它们被平庸但幸运的人所追求。
 在他最好的卖家中，“异常值”，Malcolm Grortwell报道说，一名不成比例的专业曲棍球运动员欠他们在1月出生的事故中取得成功，这使得他们成为每个青年联盟成长的最古老，最有经验的球员。因为这个原因，他们更有可能制造全明星队，接受特殊教练，最终成为专业人士。
 询问公司的任何创始人或首席执行官为什么他们的公司表现良好，他们通常会获得与勤奋执行的辉煌战略。是地面现实吗？据CEO对公司成功的贡献估计，但一项研究发现，取决于行业，它取决于2％至22％。
 行业和宏观经济因素往往更多地为公司成功而言，首席执行官无法控制的因素
  很多人都努力工作，但并非所有人都成功了。你如何解释一下，如果努力工作=成功？来自Warren Buffett，谁说他赢得了“卵巢彩票”的风险资本家弗雷德威尔逊，很多聪明，勤劳，勤劳的人承认运气在成功中发挥了作用。然而，我们大多数人都驳回了运气。事实上，我们中的许多人似乎害怕给好运，因为我们觉得我们的才华或努力工作如此贬值。通过认识到幸运在我们的生活中发挥了幸运，我们可以谦卑地前进，略低一点。这是对长期成功的巨大投资。
note_en:
All of us are brought up with the belief that working hard will equal success. In school we’re taught that if we study harder, we’ll get better grades. In sports if we practice more, we’ll perform better and at work if we work harder, we will be more successful. I too grew up with that belief but of late I have begun to change my mind.
 Talent, hard work and perseverance are all necessary but not a sufficient condition to succeed in life.
 1 ) Bill Gates was lucky to be born into a well-to-do family. His mother’s social connection with IBM’s chairman enabled him to gain a contract from the then-leading PC company that was crucial for establishing his software empire. 2)  Google founders, Sergey Brin and Larry Page, tried to sell their company for $1 million back in the 90s to Excite.com. Luckily, the deal did not happen. 3) A young  Sachin Tendulkar wanted to be a fast bowler. But when he visited the MRF Pace Foundation in Chennai, Aussie legend Dennis Lillee advised Sachin to focus on his batting instead. What if the meeting with Lillee did not take place? Or Sachin had chosen to disregard the advice anyways? 4)  Amitabh Bachchan wished to become a radio presenter but was repeatedly rejected by All India Radio (AIR). What if Mr. Bachchan had passed the AIR test and made a career in radio instead of movies?
 No one can deny that all the above individuals put in a great amount of hard work to achieve professional success in their respective careers. But as we can see, luck too played a key part.
  In recent years, a number of studies have suggested that  luck and opportunity play a far greater role than we ever realized.
 Gregory Clark, an economics professor used uncommon surnames to match up the wealth of parents and that of their offspring in several countries around the world  over 800 years. He discovered that “the rich beget the rich, the poor beget the poor.” This is not just about transfer of wealth. It is as much about gifts of healthy genes, confidence, education, and connections that comes with being lucky enough to be born into a well-to-do family.
 Clark confirms that where you start has a lot to do with where you end up.
 How about the role that luck plays in career success?  Three Italian professors created a model to track the success of 1,000 individuals over a series of lucky and unlucky events spanning 40-year careers. The result?
 They found that almost never do the most talented people reach the highest peaks of success. They are overtaken by mediocre but luckier individuals.
 In his best seller, “Outliers,”  Malcolm Gladwell reports that a disproportionate number of professional hockey players owe their success to the accident of having been born in January, which made them the oldest, most experienced players in every youth league growing up. For that reason alone, they were more likely to make all-star teams, receive special coaching and eventually become professionals.
 Ask any Founder or CEO of a company why their company is doing well, and they’ll typically credit a brilliant strategy coupled with diligent execution. Is that the ground reality? Estimates of CEOs’ contribution to companies’ success vary, but  one study found that it varies between 2% to 22% depending on the industry.
 Industry and macroeconomic factors tended to matter more for success of the company - factors over which the CEO had no control
  A lot of people work hard but not all of them are successful. How do you explain that if hard work = success? From Warren Buffett, who says he won the “Ovarian Lottery,” to the venture capitalist  Fred Wilson, a lot of smart, industrious and hard-working people admit that luck played a role in their success. However, most of us dismiss luck. Many of us, in fact, seem to be scared to give luck any credit because we feel doing so devalues our talent or hard work. By recognizing the role luck has played in our lives, we can go forward with just a little more humility and a little less ego. And that is a great investment for long-term success.
title: 为什么成功比努力工作更好
title_en: Why Success is more Luck than Hard Work

南公园公园是自组织的宗旨和技术人员统一，统一自2015年以来的故意探索的共同挑战。在2021年初，我们开始了一个从我们一起学到的内容中逃出的实验：如果我们投资了什么在他们解决一个想法之前启动创始人？我们会发现很快是易于创始人的队列，为他们提供400万美元的资金和他们需要验证市场并迭代想法的奖励，并帮助他们从地面上获得公司。我们称之为创始人奖学金，因为它在他们解决了一个想法之前对创始人进行了赌注。结果到目前为止让我们相信我们正在进行某事。现在我们很高兴为我们的第二次伙伴开放申请。
 我们对奖学金的理由保持不变。经常，创始人没有时间正确训练他们的想法。他们被迫出发，而不发展他们的想法实际上是飞行的高度信念。创始人奖学金是一个彻底的飞行前计划。我们提供资金和专家指导来审查一个想法的飞行准备情况，课程，以确保创始人知道如何试探他们的项目，以及跑道开始。
 我们特别为奖学金有助于开辟太多营业型创业和风险投资的世界。我们不认为研究员已经知道如何招聘或获取第一个客户;没有期望在之前或知道任何VCS之前曾经举过种子。如果这不是您的第一个启动，我们会在启动之前为您提供空间和资源，以完全探索您的新手。奖学金的目的是帮助止痛点和锁定盖茨，让潜在的创始人从启动公司开始。
 在过去的几个月里，我们来更好地了解我们创建的格式的全部价值。在Fellowship的核心是启动论坛，一个由SPC社区集体知识构建的课程，并由SPC基金，Avichal Garg和Curtis Spencer组装。课程特征在家中，所有创始人都需要从-1到0.几乎每个队列中的每个人都引用了其他研究员的支持，作为该计划的亮点。它反映了SPC的核心哲学：与互相支持的建筑商和技术人员的意图探索。
 我们迫不及待地等待帮助我们的下一个队列发展成为一群紧密编织的雄心勃勃的创始人。如果您渴望启动风险规模公司，我们鼓励您申请。
     SPC的创始人团契是企业家开始高增长，风险支持的启动的不同方式。我们为创始人提供他们的第一个外部投资，帮助他们传播并迭代可行的产品，并协助他们从世界上最好的VCS提升。
 我们采取精品和定制的方法来帮助创始人，认识到一定规模的拟合途径，始朗公司很少有效。我们的队列大小很小，每两个公司都有一个合作伙伴。我们没有演示日，当您提出的时间是正确的，我们将向最好的投资者提出介绍。我们不强制严格的时间表。 
我们为创始人提供40万美元的创意，通过安全换取7％的公平。我们可以帮助识别正确的市场，在建立您的第一个产品时支持您，找到第一个客户，帮助培养种子，甚至帮助找到联合创始人。
      12周的课程 -  SPC社区与其他创始人和领域专家进行了课程，以专有课程为中心。我们已经收集了时间测试的文章，视频和思考市场，想法和产品的书籍，这是世界上最好的创始人和投资者的方式。这有助于创始人避免常见的陷阱，并增加他们创造成功的高增长启动的机会。 Startup论坛由SPC和访问合作伙伴领导。
 扬声器系列 - 我们邀请发言人参加我们的每周论坛，加入我们的晚餐，以及一次性活动。现有的发言者包括Mike Krieger（Instagram），Mathilde Collin（Front），Tope Avotona（Calessy），Nathan Blecharczyk（Airbnb），Reid Hoffman（Linkedin），Elad Gil（Color），Connie Chan（Andreessen Horowitz）等等。
  基于里程碑的研讨会 - 与基金合作伙伴和同行家一起工作，以击中一个想象力，验证和原型阶段的里程碑。这些会议有助于共享目标，构建势头和推动责任。
 实验室专注于“做”。 - 伙伴领导的建筑集团专注于技术仪器，原型，产品指标，PMF，连续部署的最佳实践等。
 校友论坛 - 一个在线论坛，继续与您的COSHORT和SPC校友中的其他创始人进行对话，以便在奖学金结束后甚至在社区的建议和帮助他人的建议。
 在人工智能，机器学习，自动驾驶车辆，区块链，金融气，社交网络，能源，开发工具等方面的各种领域访问域专家。 
从Seegai，Google和SpaceX的公司访问从种子阶段到IPO的创始人和高管网络，以突破Figma，Iconion，Airtable，飞行员，复合等公司。
 实践筹款支持，以提高种子回合，包括制定音高甲板和顶级天使投资者，种子公司和VCS的指导。
  我们帮助-1到0阶段，即使在创始人有一个想法之前也是如此。
 对贵公司的更多资金和更高的估值。大多数加速器提供更小的支票，以获得更多股权。我们为较低的公平提供400万美元，在许多情况下估值增加了一倍。我们相信伟大的想法可能需要超过几个月的时间来实现，而且创始人应该避免太快地移动，因为它们是现金约束。
 不需要知道。我们可以帮助您找到一个很好的市场和想法，您非常适合您。
 没有演示日压。我们将帮助您在对您的产品和公司有意义的时间表上筹集一轮。
 没有固定的时间表。金融气，生物技术，区块链和消费者初创企业需要不同的时间来摆脱地面。我们将在为您的想法上最有意义的时间表上验证验证的想法和筹款。 
据说，一个好主意是长期成功的关键组成部分。如果您没有想法，我们需要评估您产生伟大想法的能力。准备讨论市场您发现有趣，以前的想法，您已经考虑并丢弃，以及您发现引人注目的初创思想和见解以及为什么。
  我们接受独奏创始人，尽管我们通常对团队偏好。启动公司独唱可能具有挑战性，我们听到我们的研究员听到了一个合作者在这段旅程中非常有价值。如果您是一个独奏创始人，我们对拥有建立和原型技能的申请人有强烈的偏见。如果您被视为独奏创始人，但仍然想要一个联合创始人，我们可以帮助搜索过程 - 我们的几个第一个队列研究员在SPC社区找到了联合创始人。
  位置：该程序将与远程和In-Perse选项混合。所有活动都将包括远程访问，但我们还将在湾区的人员提供某些事件的人员。所有编程将基于太平洋时区。您不需要在湾区或美国申请或参加。
  由Ruchi Sanghvi，Aditya Agarwal，Avichal Garg，Curtis Spencer，Finn Meeks和Mitra Lohrasbpour组织和运营了创始人奖学金。我们是建设者，企业家和热爱其他企业家成功的技术人员。我们已成功启动和退出五家公司，在Facebook，Dropbox和Google中致力于领导力，已成为突破Unicorns的董事会成员，并已成为Angel Investors，其中包含超过500亿美元的市场上限。

South Park Commons is a self-organizing community of tinkerers and technologists united around a shared ethos of intentional exploration since 2015. At the beginning of 2021, we  began an experiment that grew out of what we’ve learned together: what if we invested in startup founders before they’d settled on an idea? We’d find a cohort of promising soon-to-be founders, give them $400k in funding and the mentorship they need to validate a market and iterate on ideas, and help them get a company off the ground. We called it the Founder Fellowship, because it’s a bet on founders before they’ve settled on an idea. The results so far leave us confident that we’re on to something. Now we’re excited to open applications for our second cohort of fellows.
 Our rationale for the Fellowship remains the same. Too often, founders don’t have the time to properly vet their ideas. They are forced to set off without developing a high level of conviction that their idea will actually take flight. The Founder Fellowship is a thorough pre-flight program. We provide the funding and expert guidance to vet the flight-readiness of an idea, the curriculum to make sure founders know how to pilot their project, and the runway to get started.
 We’re particularly proud that the Fellowship helps open up the too-often insular world of startups and venture capital. We don’t assume that fellows already know how to sequence hiring or acquire first customers; there’s no expectation that you’ve raised a seed round before or know any VCs. And if this isn’t your first startup, we give you the space and resources to fully explore your new one before launching. The purpose of the Fellowship is to help with the pain points and locked gates that keep would-be founders from starting a company.
 Over the last several months we’ve come to better understand the full value of the format we created. At the Fellowship’s core is the Startup Forum, a curriculum built from the collective knowledge of the SPC community and assembled by the SPC Fund, Avichal Garg, and Curtis Spencer. The curriculum features everything founders need to know to get from -1 to 0. In addition to the Forum and bespoke mentorship from fund and visiting partners, fellows participate in peer workshops that provide both professional and personal support. Nearly every fellow in the first cohort cited support from other fellows as a highlight of the program. It reflects the core philosophy of SPC: intentional exploration with a mutually-supportive peer group of builders and technologists.
 We can’t wait to help our next cohort develop into a close-knit group of ambitious founders. If you aspire to start a venture-scale company, we encourage you to apply.
     SPC’s Founder Fellowship is a different way for entrepreneurs to start a high growth, venture-backable startup. We give founders their first outside investment, help them ideate and iterate to a viable product, and assist them in raising from the best VCs in the world.
 We take a boutique and customized approach to helping founders, recognizing that a one-size-fits-all approach to starting companies rarely works. Our cohort sizes are small, with one partner for every two companies. We do not have a demo day, and when the time is right for you to raise, we’ll make introductions to the best investors. We do not force strict timelines.
 We offer $400,000 to founders to pursue an idea, in exchange for 7% equity via a SAFE. We can help identify the right market, support you as you build your first product, find first customers, help raise a seed round, and even help find co-founders.
      12-week Curriculum — program put on by the SPC Community with other founders and domain experts, centered around a proprietary curriculum. We have collected time-tested articles, videos, and books on thinking about markets, ideas, and products the way the world’s best founders and investors do. This helps founders avoid common pitfalls and increase their chances of creating a successful high growth startup. The Startup Forum is led by SPC and visiting partners.
 Speaker Series — we invite speakers to attend our weekly Forum, to join us for dinners, and for one-off events. Prior speakers have included Mike Krieger (Instagram), Mathilde Collin (Front), Tope Awotona (Calendly), Nathan Blecharczyk (Airbnb), Reid Hoffman (LinkedIn), Elad Gil (Color), Connie Chan (Andreessen Horowitz), and more.
  Milestone-based workshops — work with fund partners and peer fellows to hit milestones in the ideation, validation, and prototyping phases. These sessions help share goals, build momentum, and drive accountability.
 Labs focused on “doing.” — partner-led building groups focused on technical instrumentation, prototyping, product metrics, PMF, best practices for continuous deployment, etc.
 Alumni Forum — an online forum to continue the conversation with other founders in your cohort and SPC alumni to ask for advice and help others in the community, even after the fellowship is over.
 Access to domain experts across a variety of fields in artificial intelligence, machine learning, self driving vehicles, blockchain, fintech, social networks, energy, developer tools, and more.
 Access to a network of founders and executives from the seed stage to IPO at companies ranging from OpenAI, Google, and SpaceX to breakout companies such as Figma, Notion, Airtable, Pilot, Compound and more.
 Hands-on fundraising support to raise your seed round, including guidance crafting a pitch deck and introductions to top angel investors, seed firms, and VCs.
  We help at the -1 to 0 phase, even before a founder has an idea.
 More money and a higher valuation for your company. Most accelerators offer smaller checks for more equity. We offer $400K for less equity, in many cases more than doubling your valuation. We believe great ideas may take more than a few months to materialize and founders should avoid moving too quickly because they are cash-constrained.
 No idea necessary. We can help you find a great market and idea for which you are well suited.
 No demo day pressure. We will help you raise your round on the timeline that makes sense for your product and company.
 No fixed timelines. Fintech, biotech, blockchain, and consumer startups need different amounts of time to get off the ground. We’ll work on validating ideas and fundraising on a timeline that makes the most sense for your idea.
   That being said, a great idea is a critical component of long term success. If you do not have an idea, we will need to assess your ability to generate great ideas. Be prepared to discuss markets you find interesting, previous ideas you have considered and discarded, and the sorts of startup ideas and insights you find compelling and why.
  We do accept solo founders, though we generally have a preference for teams. It can be challenging to start a company solo, and we hear from our fellows that having a collaborator is extremely valuable on this journey. If you’re a solo founder, we have a strong bias towards applicants who have the skills to build and prototype. If you are accepted as a solo founder but still want a co-founder, we can help in the search process — several of our first cohort fellows found co-founders in the SPC community.
  Location: The program will be hybrid with both remote and in-person options. All events will include remote access, but we’ll also have in-person access for people in the Bay Area for some events. All programming will be based on Pacific Time Zone hours.  You do not need to be in the Bay Area or United States to apply or participate.
  The Founder Fellowship is organized and run by Ruchi Sanghvi, Aditya Agarwal, Avichal Garg, Curtis Spencer, Finn Meeks, and Mitra Lohrasbpour. We are builders, entrepreneurs, and technologists who love helping other entrepreneurs succeed. We have successfully started and exited five companies, served in leadership roles at Facebook, Dropbox, and Google, have been board members for breakout unicorns, and have been angel investors in companies with a combined market cap of over $50 billion.
 70+ companies have used the South Park Commons approach since 2017 and have raised $500M+ in funding for a combined market cap of over $3B.

 旋转驱动轮通常配备有销，该销达到位于另一个车轮（从动轮）中的槽中，一次前进一步。驱动轮还具有升高的圆形阻挡盘，＆＃34;锁和＃34;旋转从动车轮在步骤之间的位置。
     Geneva Drive的名称来自于最早的机械手表的应用程序，这在日内瓦普及，是制表业的古典起源[引用]。该机构经常用于机械手表，因为它可以使其变小并且能够承受显着的机械应力。
 日内瓦驱动器也被称为A＆＃34;马耳他交叉机制＆＃34;由于当旋转轮有四个辐条时，由于视觉相似。
 在日内瓦驱动的最常见的布置中，客户轮具有四个槽，因此每次旋转的时间（每个步骤为90度），通过一步进步。如果转向轮具有n个槽，则它在螺旋桨轮的全旋转中推进360°/ n。
 因为机制需要很好地润滑，所以它通常封闭在油胶囊中。 [所需的引用]
    Geneva Drive的一个应用是在电影电影投影仪和电影摄像机中，其中胶片通过曝光门，周期性开始和停止。薄膜通过框架推进框架，每个帧仍然位于镜头前面的镜头周期的一部分（通常以每秒24个循环的速率），并且在循环的其余部分期间快速加速，推进和减速。这种间歇运动由日内瓦驱动器实现，这又致动爪，该爪与膜中的链轮孔接合。日内瓦驱动器还提供了一种精确的可重复停止位置，这对于最小化连续图像中的抖动至关重要。 （现代薄膜投影仪也可以使用电子控制的分度机构或步进电机，该机构允许快速转发电影。）日内瓦驱动器在电影投影机中的首次用途日期为1896年，与Oskar Messter和Max Gliewe的投影仪Robert William Paul的陶器。以前的投影仪，包括托马斯ARMAT＆＃39; S Projector，被爱迪生销售为Vitascope，使用了A＆＃34; Beatter机制＆＃34;由GeorgesDemenō在1893年发明，以实现间歇电影运输。 
具有从动轮形式的日内瓦轮也用于机械手表，但不在驱动器中，而不是限制弹簧的张力，使得它仅在其弹力几乎线性的范围内操作。如果从动轮的一个槽被遮挡，则驱动轮可以制造的旋转次数是有限的。在手表中，＆＃34;驾驶＆＃34;车轮是卷起弹簧的那个，并且日内瓦轮有四个或五个辐条和一个封闭的槽可以防止弹簧的过度延伸（并且还完成展开）。这个所谓的日内瓦停止或＆＃34;日内瓦停止工作＆＃34;是17世纪或18世纪的钟表制造商的发明。
 日内瓦驱动器的其他应用包括绘图仪，自动采样设备，纸币计数机以及制造中使用的多种形式的可转位设备（如CNC机器的换刀器;炮塔车床，螺旋桨，和炮塔钻;某种分数头和旋转桌;等等）。铁环时钟使用日内瓦机制来为其一个环提供间歇性运动。
 日内瓦驱动器用于更改黎明任务框架摄像机中的过滤器，用于在2011年进行图像的小行星4 Vesta。它被选中以确保该机制至少将使用一个过滤器来使用。 [1] [2]
  内部日内瓦驱动器是设计上的变体。内部驱动器的驱动轮的轴仅在一侧具有轴承。驱动轮必须旋转到效果的角度在外部日内瓦驱动器中始终小于180°，并且在内部始终大于180°，因此切换时间大于驾驶轮仍然存在。
  外形更常见，因为它可以构建较小并且可以承受更高的机械应力。 [所需的引用]
       该图显示了以任意单位为单位的外部四槽日内瓦驱动器的运动曲线。当驱动引脚进入并离开槽时，加速度出现了不连续性，在刚性轴承表面发生接触或分开时发生。这产生了一个＆＃34;无限＆＃34;混蛋峰（DiacaC峰），从而振动。

Jump to navigation  Jump to search  The  Geneva drive or  Maltese cross is a  gear mechanism that translates a continuous  rotation movement into intermittent rotary motion.
 The  rotating drive  wheel is usually equipped with a  pin that reaches into a slot located in the other wheel ( driven wheel ) that advances it by one step at a time. The drive wheel also has an elevated circular blocking disc that "locks" the rotating driven wheel in position between steps.
     The name, Geneva drive, is derived from the devices earliest application in  mechanical watches, which were popularized in  Geneva, being the classical origin of watchmaking industry [   citation needed]. The mechanism is frequently used in mechanical  watches, since it can be made small and is able to withstand substantial mechanical stress.
 The  Geneva drive is also called a " Maltese cross mechanism" due to the visual resemblance when the rotating wheel has four  spokes.
 In the most common arrangement of the Geneva drive, the client wheel has four slots and thus advances the drive by one step at a time (each step being 90  degrees) for each full rotation of the master wheel. If the steered wheel has  n slots, it advances by 360°/ n per full rotation of the propeller wheel.
 Because the mechanism needs to be well lubricated, it is often enclosed in an oil capsule. [   citation needed]
    One application of the Geneva drive is in film  movie projectors and movie cameras, where the film is pulled through an exposure gate with periodic starts and stops. The film advances frame by frame, each frame standing still in front of the lens for a portion of the frame cycle (typically at a rate of 24 cycles per second), and rapidly accelerating, advancing, and decelerating during the rest of the cycle. This intermittent motion is implemented by a Geneva drive, which in turn actuates a claw that engages sprocket holes in the film. The Geneva drive also provides a precisely repeatable stopped position, which is critical to minimizing jitter in the successive images. (Modern film projectors may also use an electronically controlled indexing mechanism or  stepper motor, which allows for fast-forwarding the film.) The first uses of the Geneva drive in film projectors date to 1896, with the projectors of  Oskar Messter and Max Gliewe and the  Teatrograph of  Robert William Paul. Previous projectors, including  Thomas Armat's projector, marketed by  Edison as the  Vitascope, had used a "beater mechanism", invented by  Georges Demenÿ in 1893, to achieve intermittent film transport.
 Geneva wheels having the form of the driven wheel were also used in mechanical  watches, but not in a drive, rather to limit the tension of the  spring, such that it would operate only in the range where its  elastic force is nearly linear. If one of the slots of the driven wheel is occluded, the number of rotations the drive wheel can make is limited. In watches, the "drive" wheel is the one that winds up the spring, and the Geneva wheel with four or five spokes and one closed slot prevents overwinding (and also complete unwinding) of the spring. This so-called  Geneva stop or "Geneva stop work" was the invention of 17th or 18th century watchmakers.
 Other applications of the Geneva drive include the pen change mechanism in  plotters, automated sampling devices,  banknote counting machines, and many forms of  indexable equipment used in manufacturing (such as the tool changers in  CNC machines; the turrets of  turret lathes,  screw machines, and turret drills; some kinds of  indexing heads and  rotary tables; and so on). The  Iron Ring Clock uses a Geneva mechanism to provide intermittent motion to one of its rings.
 A Geneva drive was used to change filters in the  Dawn mission framing camera used to image the asteroid  4 Vesta in 2011. It was selected to ensure that should the mechanism fail at least one filter would be usable.  [1]  [2]
  An internal Geneva drive is a variant on the design. The axis of the drive wheel of the internal drive can have a bearing only on one side. The angle by which the drive wheel has to rotate to effect one step rotation of the driven wheel is always smaller than 180° in an external Geneva drive and always greater than 180° in an internal one, where the switch time is therefore greater than the time the driven wheel stands still.
  The external form is the more common, as it can be built smaller and can withstand higher mechanical  stresses. [   citation needed]
       The figure shows the motion curves for an external four-slot Geneva drive, in arbitrary units. A discontinuity appears in the acceleration when the drive pin enters and leaves the slot, occurring at the instant the rigid bearing surfaces make contact or separate. This generates an "infinite" peak of  jerk ( Dirac peak), and therefore vibrations.
    ^    Christopher Russell; Carol Raymond (2012).   The Dawn Mission to Minor Planets 4 Vesta and 1 Ceres. Springer.
 ^    Bickford, John H. (1972). "Geneva Mechanisms".   Mechanisms for intermittent motion  (PDF). New York: Industrial Press inc. 128.  ISBN   0-8311-1091-0.
  Sclater, Neil (2011), "Cam, Geneva, and Ratchet Drives and Mechanisms",  Mechanisms and Mechanical Devices Sourcebook (5th ed.), New York: McGraw Hill, pp. 180–210,  ISBN   978-0-07170442-7 . Drawings and designs of various drives.

两个可怕的冠状病毒变体迅速推翻了美国先前最可怕的变种。他们的上升正在使专家担心该国可以看到Covid-19的持续爆发和复兴，除非目前的疫苗接种速度迅速加速。
 alpha-以前称为B.1.1.7的变种，并在英国的首先在年初席卷该国。它估计比武汉武汉蘑菇中的大流行冠状病毒的版本更传播了50％左右，从而在2020年，英国的阿尔法在英国的崛起与案件的激增有关病毒变异迅速占其中的90％以上。同样，在美国，alpha在今年的几个月内成为主要的菌株，并在4月底占循环菌株的大约70％。
 但根据新鲜数据，另外两种变体现在威胁到美国的统治：三角洲（在印度首次检测到的AKA B.1.617.2）和伽玛（阿卡P.1，在巴西和日本检测到。 Delta被认为是最有关的变体。虽然疫苗对δ仍然有效，但估计变异率比α比α更具传染性的50％至60％，并且证据表明它可能导致更严重的疾病。当Delta于4月初在英国出现时，它迅速克服alpha，现在占案件的90％左右。另一方面，伽玛并不是如此快速的展示，但它确实略微击退了疫苗的有效性。
 根据周一在线发布的数据，在预印刷服务器上，Delta和Gamma正在浪费美国在美国中的alpha杂乱，已经从统治中脱落。 Alpha从4月份的70％从40％下降到目前的低点约为35％。在预印学生中，截至6月9日，三角洲和伽玛共同组成约30％的案例，三角洲占案件的14％，伽玛占16％左右。
 来自疾病控制和预防中心的数据在星期二估计的白宫新闻发布会上提出，截至6月19日，三角洲的全国案件份额现在高达20.6％。
     尚未对同行评审的预印学生由加利福尼亚州的基因组学士螺旋的研究人员经营。该公司正在使用CDC来帮助监控SARS-COV-2变体。螺旋研究人员自1月2021年1月以来收集了近244,000个阳性SARS-COV-2样品的数据。自4月以来，它们在全国747个县中收集了近20,000个病毒分离物的遗传序列。
 该研究具有局限性，最近几周收集的样本数量较少，给出了在传播的速度放缓。虽然作者建议他们的数据集不应偏向任何特定的变体，但他们注意到样品“不按人口成比例地代表美国的不同区域”。例如，从佛罗里达州收集约25％的样品。但是，当他们爆发分析时，他们仍然可以看到全国范围的趋势。 
总的来说，数据很清楚，三角洲和伽玛正在接管。特别是三角洲正在蔓延最快。它远远超过伽玛，并将其成为美国的主要变种，正如英国所做的那样。
 仍然，两个变体都有优势。当研究人员看着两种县中的两个变种如何蔓延，他们发现：
 Δδ的生长曲线，其更传染性，但疫苗对哪种疫苗非常有效，患有较低疫苗接种率的县的增长更快。相反，γ较小，但较差的疫苗具有稍微较小的疫苗，具有较高疫苗接种率的县具有更高的患病率。
 这些数据支持专家的呼吁，让人们接受疫苗接种，并接种疫苗的人仍然警惕。在白宫新闻简报周二，顶级传染病专家Anthony Fauci呼应了这个问题，致电了该国走出了大流行的“最大的威胁”。
  Fauci指出，34个州的成年人群占疫苗的70％。 Fauci表示，有一个“真正的危险”，Delta Variant可以将Covid-19案件的当地潮流进入秋季疫苗率低的地方。
 “结论：我们有这些工具，”他说，提到有效的疫苗，“所以让我们使用它们并粉碎爆发。”

Two dreaded coronavirus variants are swiftly overthrowing the previously most-dreaded variant in the US. Their ascendance is making experts worry that the country could see continued outbreaks and resurgences of COVID-19 unless the current sluggish pace of vaccination quickens.
 Alpha—the variant formerly known as B.1.1.7 and first identified in the UK—swept the country at the start of the year. It’s estimated to be around 50 percent more transmissible than the version of the pandemic coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2, that mushroomed out of Wuhan, China, in 2020. Alpha’s rise in the UK last fall was linked to a surge in cases as the virus variant quickly accounted for more than 90 percent of cases there. Likewise, in the US, Alpha became the predominant strain in a matter of months this year and accounted for around 70 percent of the circulating strains by the end of April.
 But according to  fresh data, two other variants now threaten Alpha’s reign in the US: Delta (aka B.1.617.2, first detected in India) and Gamma (aka P.1, first detected in Brazil and Japan). Delta is considered the most concerning variant seen yet. Though vaccines are still effective against Delta, the variant is estimated to be 50 percent to 60 percent more contagious than Alpha, and evidence suggests that it may cause more severe disease. When Delta first appeared in the UK at the start of April, it rapidly overcame Alpha and now accounts for around 90 percent of cases. Gamma, on the other hand, is not such a rapid spreader, but it does slightly knock back the effectiveness of vaccines.
 According to the data posted online Monday on a preprint server, Delta and Gamma are wasting no time collectively overtaking Alpha in the US, which has already fallen from dominance. Alpha dropped from 70 percent of cases in April to its current low of around  35 percent. In the preprint study, Delta and Gamma collectively made up around 30 percent of all case in the US as of June 9, with Delta making up around 14 percent of cases and Gamma making up around 16 percent.
 Data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention presented in a White House press conference Tuesday estimate that, as of June 19, Delta’s share of cases nationwide is now up to  20.6 percent.
     The preprint study, which has not been peer-reviewed, was run by California-based researchers at the genomics company Helix. The company is working with the CDC to help monitor SARS-CoV-2 variants. Helix researchers had data on nearly 244,000 positive SARS-CoV-2 samples collected since January 2021. And they had the genetic sequences of nearly 20,000 virus isolates collected across 747 counties nationwide since April.
 The study has limitations, most notably the smaller number of samples collected in recent weeks given a welcomed slowdown in transmission. Though the authors suggest their data set shouldn’t be biased toward any specific variant, they do note that the samples “do not proportionally represent the different areas of the United States by population.” About 25 percent of the samples were collected from Florida, for instance. However, when they did break out analyses, they could still see nationwide trends.
 Overall, the data was clear that Delta and Gamma are taking over. And Delta in particular is spreading the fastest. It is outpacing Gamma and set to become the predominant variant in the US, as it did in the UK.
 Still, both variants have advantages. When the researchers looked at how the two variants were spreading in various counties, they found that:
 The growth curve for [Delta], which is more transmissible but against which vaccines are highly effective, shows faster growth in counties with lower vaccination rates. In contrast, [Gamma], which is less transmissible but against which vaccines have somewhat less efficacy, has a higher prevalence in counties with higher vaccination rates.
 The data supports experts’ calls for people to get vaccinated and for vaccinated people to remain vigilant. In the White House press briefing Tuesday, top infectious disease expert Anthony Fauci echoed the concern, calling Delta the “greatest threat” to the country’s path out of the pandemic.
  Fauci noted that 34 states have less than 70 percent of their adult populations vaccinated. There’s a “real danger,” Fauci said, that the Delta variant could drive local surges in COVID-19 cases into the fall in places with low vaccination rates.
 “Conclusion: We have the tools,” he said, referring to effective vaccines, “so let’s use them and crush the outbreak.”

title_en: Once-dreaded Alpha variant is falling fast—Delta and Gamma take over
